snippet: France answered an urgent plea from the government of its former colony to help blunt an advance into the center of the country by Islamist extremist militants.
abstract: French forces engage in intense battle to beat back aggressive push by militant Islamists in northern Mali, decisive turn in the international standoff; Pentagon will now weigh broad range of options to support French effort, but will not consider sending American troops.

byline.original: By ADAM NOSSITER and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor:
Adam Nossiter reported from Bamako and Eric Schmitt from Niamey, Niger. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York,
and Scott Sayare from Paris.

lead_paragraph: France answered an urgent plea from the government of its former colony to help blunt an advance into the center of the country by Islamist extremist militants.

headline.seo: French Troops Help Mali Halt an Islamist Advance
